item.title: Global (Germany) - Email Validation degradation
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Email Validation Service Outage

During the specified timeframe, a portion of the email validation requests returned errors due to an issue with the Email Validation service processed over the Global (Germany) data center. The dedicated team is actively working on resolving the issue. Summary:

Mar 6, 22:06 UTC
Resolved - The issue has been successfully resolved and the service is once again operational.
During the specified timeframe, you may have experienced errors with your Email Validation request.

Start (UTC): 06 March 20:30
End (UTC): 06 March 21:48

Impact: A portion of your email validation request may have returned errors.

Mar 6, 21:54 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing a problem with Email Validation service request processed over our Global (Germany) data center.
You may experience a portion of your email validation request return errors.
Our dedicated team is working on the issue and more information will follow in the next update.

item.title: Global (Germany) - Planned maintenance of Integrations database infrastructure
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Database Patching Process at Global Data Center Summary: Scheduled maintenance will be performed to upgrade and optimize databases utilized by the Integrations services hosted at the Global (Germany) data center. Intermittent errors may be encountered during the maintenance period when using Oracle Cx Marketing or Oracle Eloqua integrations. No major outage is expected.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 20, 08:00 - 09:00 UTC

Mar 5, 13:52 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing a patching process of databases utilized by the Integrations services hosted at our Global (Germany) data center.

Throughout the maintenance period, there is a possibility of encountering intermittent errors when attempting to utilize the Oracle Cx Marketing or the Oracle Eloqua integrations.

Start: 20 March 2024 08:00 UTC
End: 20 March 2024 09:00 UTC
Purpose: Database upgrade and optimization

item.title: Global (Germany) - Planned maintenance of Mobile Identity database infrastructure
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Database Patching at Global Data Center

Summary: The company will be performing a patching process of Mobile Identity databases hosted at their Global (Germany) data center. This may result in intermittent errors such as EC_INTERNAL_ERROR during the maintenance period. The purpose of the maintenance is the upgrade and optimization of the databases.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 19, 12:00 - 12:30 UTC

Mar 5, 13:15 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing a patching process of Mobile Identity databases hosted at our Global (Germany) data center.
Throughout the maintenance period, there is a possibility of encountering intermittent errors, such as EC_INTERNAL_ERROR, when attempting to utilize the Mobile Identity service. These errors may occur as our team executes crucial steps of the activity.

Start: 19 March 2024 12:00 UTC
End: 19 March 2024 12:30 UTC
Purpose: Database upgrade and optimization

item.title: Global (Germany) - Flow People Import degradation
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major People Import Service Outage in Global (Germany) Data Center

We are currently experiencing issues with the People Import service on our Global (Germany) data center, affecting the creation of Moments - Flow campaigns. A fix has been implemented, and we are monitoring the results for further updates.

Mar 5, 11:57 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. More information will follow in the next update.

Mar 5, 11:29 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing issues with the People Import service on our Global (Germany) data center. This is affecting the creation of Moments - Flow campaigns as you may experience issues when importing audiences.
We are investigating the issues and will keep you posted with further updates.

item.title: General connectivity issues towards Turkey data center
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Connectivity Issue in Turkey Data Center

We're currently experiencing a general connectivity issue with our Turkey data center. Clients utilizing hosted services may experience irregularities in sending traffic, delays, and issues in receiving delivery reports. We're currently investigating the issue and keep you updated.

Feb 29, 09:45 UTC
Investigating - Please note that we're currently experiencing a general connectivity issue with our Turkey data center. Clients utilizing hosted services may experience irregularities in sending traffic, delays, and issues in receiving delivery reports. We're currently investigating the issue and keep you updated.

item.title: Global (Germany) - Degradation of newly created HTTP API Keys
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Outage at Global Data Center in Germany

Investigating HTTP API status code 401 responses for requests submitted using newly created API Keys as the authorization method.

Feb 28, 11:07 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing issues on our Global (Germany) data center due to which you may observe HTTP API status code 401 responses for requests submitted using newly created API Keys as the authorization method.
This is being investigated and we will keep you posted with further updates.

item.title: Global (Germany) - Planned maintenance of database infrastructure
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Database Patching Maintenance Summary: Scheduled maintenance for security patching and optimization of multiple databases hosted on the Global (Germany) data center may cause downtime or degraded performance for various services. Scheduled to occur from 22:00 to 23:00 UTC on March 12, 2024.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 12, 22:00 - 23:00 UTC

Feb 26, 14:40 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing a patching process of multiple databases hosted on our Global (Germany) data center. During the maintenance window, a few minutes of downtime or degraded performance is expected for a varied range of services hosted on the data center.

Start (UTC): 12 March 2024 22:00
End (UTC): 12 March 2024 23:00
Purpose: Security patching and optimization

item.title: SSL certificate renewal of *.email-api-us.infobip.com
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - SSL Certificate Renewal

Summary: Infobip will be performing automatic renewal of their SSL certificate *.email-api-us.infobip.com between April 29, 14:00 UTC and 20:00 UTC. No action is required unless the leaf certificate is pinned.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 29, 14:00 - 20:00 UTC

Feb 23, 14:09 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing automatic renewal of our SSL certificate *.email-api-us.infobip.com, timeframe:
- Start (UTC): 29 April 14:00
- End (UTC): 29 April 20:00


No action is required, unless you do any of the following:
- Pin our leaf certificate

If you do any of the above, we encourage you to update key stores, code bases, and certificate pinnings that may be in use.

For more information, how to prepare and test please visit: https://www.infobip.com/docs/essentials/rest-api-traffic-encryption.

Should you need any additional assistance in regard to this activity,
please contact our support at support@infobip.com.

item.title: SSL certificate renewal of api-br.infobip.com and *.api-br.infobip.com endpoints
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - SSL Certificate Renewal

Summary: Infobip will be performing a renewal of the api-br.infobip.com and *.api-br.infobip.com endpoint SSL certificates. The renewals will be performed separately for each endpoint during specific timeframes. Customers who manually import Certificate Authorities (CA) or pin leaf certificates might be required to update their collection of trusted CA certificates.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 22, 12:00 - 13:00 UTC

Jan 29, 11:25 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing a renewal of the api-br.infobip.com and *.api-br.infobip.com endpoint SSL certificates. The renewals will be performed separately for each endpoint, during the following timeframes:

api-br.infobip.com
Start (UTC): 04 March 2024 14:00
End (UTC): 04 March 2024 15:00

*.api-br.infobip.com
Start (UTC): 22 March 2024 12:00
End (UTC): 22 March 2024 13:00

The new certificate will have an updated intermediate certificate in its chain of trust, therefore, customers who manually import Certificate Authorities (CA) or pin leaf certificates might be required to update their collection of trusted certificate authority (CA) certificates to trust certificates signed by "RapidSSL TLS RSA CA G1" (serial number: 14816627491795588044059060260691382010).

Should you need the certificate or any additional assistance in regard to this activity, please contact our support at support@infobip.com.

item.title: SSL certificate renewal of api-in.infobip.com and *.api-in.infobip.com endpoints
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - SSL Certificate Renewal

Summary: Infobip will be performing a renewal of the api-in.infobip.com and *.api-in.infobip.com SSL certificates, with an updated intermediate certificate. Customers who manually import Certificate Authorities may need to update their collection of trusted CA certificates.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 15, 09:00 - 10:00 UTC

Jan 29, 12:30 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing a renewal of the api-in.infobip.com and *.api-in.infobip.com endpoint SSL certificates.
The renewals will be performed separately for each endpoint, during the following timeframes:

api-in.infobip.com
Start (UTC): 04 March 2024 13:00
End (UTC): 04 March 2024 14:00

*.api-in.infobip.com
Start (UTC): 15 March 2024 09:00
End (UTC): 15 March 2024 10:00

The new certificate will have an updated intermediate certificate in its chain of trust, therefore, customers who manually import Certificate Authorities (CA) or pin leaf certificates might be required to update their collection of trusted certificate authority (CA) certificates to trust certificates signed by "RapidSSL TLS RSA CA G1" (serial number: 14816627491795588044059060260691382010).

Should you need the certificate or any additional assistance in regard to this activity, please contact our support at support@infobip.com.

item.title: SSL certificate renewal of *.api-id.infobip.com endpoint
item.content:encoded:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 4, 12:00 - 13:00 UTC

Jan 29, 13:05 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing a renewal of the *.api-id.infobip.com endpoint SSL certificate during the following timeframe:

Start (UTC): 04 March 2024 12:00
End (UTC): 04 March 2024 13:00

The new certificate will have an updated intermediate certificate in its chain of trust, therefore, customers who manually import Certificate Authorities (CA) or pin leaf certificates might be required to update their collection of trusted certificate authority (CA) certificates to trust certificates signed by "RapidSSL TLS RSA CA G1" (serial number: 14816627491795588044059060260691382010).

Should you need the certificate or any additional assistance in regard to this activity, please contact our support at support@infobip.com.

item.title: Global (Germany) - Data Center planned maintenance
item.content:encoded:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 1, 23:00 UTC  -  Mar 2, 07:00 UTC

Feb 16, 11:04 UTC
Update - This is a reminder regarding the upcoming planned maintenance scheduled for the 01 of March at 23:00 UTC.
As previously communicated, this maintenance activity is expected to entail multiple periods of up to 30 minutes during which access to certain services or systems, along with responses from our platform, might be slower than expected or even temporarily unavailable.
To ensure minimal disruption to your workflow, we advise you to plan accordingly and we appreciate your cooperation and understanding as we strive to enhance the performance and reliability of our systems.

Feb 8, 12:56 UTC
Update - UPDATE: During planning, we have determined that, as opposed to the initial notification, short periods of downtime will be expected for services hosted on the Global (Germany) Data Center within the maintenance timeframe.

In preparation for this activity, we will be following up periodically with additional reminder notifications, which will contain further updates if needed.

Feb 2, 10:35 UTC
Scheduled - We will undergo the second of two planned maintenance activities consisting of restructuring the Global (Germany) data center's infrastructure, with the goal of ensuring optimal performance of our platform.

Start (UTC): 01 March 2024 23:00
End (UTC): 02 March 2024 07:00
Purpose: Data center restructuring

During the maintenance timeframe, downtime is not expected, however, services hosted on the data center may experience short intermittent periods of degraded performance.

item.title: Global (Germany) - Data Center planned maintenance

As previously communicated, this maintenance activity is expected to entail multiple periods of up to 30 minutes during which access to certain services or systems, along with responses from our platform, might be slower than expected or even temporarily unavailable.
To ensure minimal disruption to your workflow, we advise you to plan accordingly and we appreciate your cooperation and understanding as we strive to enhance the performance and reliability of our systems.

Feb 8, 12:51 UTC

item.title: Global (Germany) - Planned maintenance of 2FA service
item.content:encoded:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 27, 21:00 - 23:00 UTC

Feb 9, 16:41 UTC
Scheduled - To enhance the performance of our platform, we have scheduled maintenance for our Global (Germany) Data Center. This maintenance involves the migration of our 2FA service databases to new clusters with the aim of optimizing their performance. Our objective is to ensure that our infrastructure operates at its highest efficiency.

Start (UTC): 27 February 2024 21:00
End (UTC): 27 February 2024 23:00
Purpose: Optimizing performance of the 2FA service

During the maintenance window, the generation and delivery of 2FA pin codes (used by our Customer Portal during login and exposed as a 2FA API) might sporadically produce unforeseen outcomes.

item.title: Multiple locations - Planned maintenance of Conversations service
item.content:encoded:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 26, 09:00 - 12:00 UTC

Feb 12, 13:50 UTC
Scheduled - We will be undergoing an upgrade of database clusters used by the Conversation service at our EU Region-locked (Germany) and Global (Germany) locations during the mentioned time period. Due to the nature of the activity and the availability of redundant nodes, customers should not experience any major disruptions of the service and only a few short interruptions of up to a minute are possible.

Start (UTC): 26 February 2024 09:00
End (UTC): 26 February 2024 12:00
Purpose: Conversations service upgrade and optimization

Should you need the certificate or any additional assistance in regard to this activity, please contact our support at support@infobip.com.

item.title: Multiple Locations - Online payments degradation
item.content:encoded:
Feb 23, 08:47 UTC
Resolved - The issue has been successfully resolved and the service is once again operational.
Despite not being present for everyone, certain accounts may have encountered sporadic issues with online payments during the specified timeframe.
Start (UTC): 22 February 2024 00:00
End (UTC): 22 February 2024 18:36
Impact: Intermittent issues with online payments

Feb 22, 18:10 UTC
Update - Our team is still working on fixing the situation, once we have more details, we will update you accordingly

Feb 22, 16:35 UTC
Update - The dedicated team continues to work in a resolution for this issue.

Feb 22, 15:59 UTC
Identified - We are currently experiencing issues with the Online Payments through Portal. Our internal team is actively investigating the extent of this issue, and further details will be provided shortly.

item.title: Global (Germany) - Customer Portal login degradation
item.content:encoded:
Feb 20, 13:58 UTC
Resolved - The issue has been successfully resolved and the service is once again operational.
During the specified time below, you may encounter difficulties with logging into the Customer Portal.

Start (UTC): 20 February 13:30
End (UTC): 20 February 13:42

Impact: Difficulties with logging into the Customer Portal.

Feb 20, 13:38 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing issues with the Customer Portal login. Our internal team is actively investigating the extent of this issue, and further details will be provided shortly.
